Zaid earns $6000 per month. He spends 1/4 of his salary on rent, so he spends 1/4 * $6000 = $1500 on rent. He spends 1/3 of his salary on car fuel, so he spends 1/3 * $6000 = $2000 on car fuel.

Wait … Wait …

After donating half of the remaining amount to his favorite charity, he has $2500 / 2 = $1250 remaining.
He gives his daughter $200 for her weekly expenses, so he now has $1250 - $200 = $1050 remaining.
He gives his wife $700 to budget for groceries and other household goods, so he now has $1050 - $700 = $350 remaining.
Therefore, Zaid has $350 remaining after all these expenses
